events.title: Start of the Battle of Gettysburg
events.description: The Battle of Gettysburg starts during the American Civil War. It was one of the largest battles and a turning point in the war.
events.significance: The Union victory at Gettysburg marked a significant turning point in the Civil War, halting the Confederate invasion of the North.

events.title: Confederation of Canada
events.description: The Dominion of Canada is formed as the British North America Act takes effect, uniting three colonies into one country.
events.significance: This marks the birth of Canada as a self-governing dominion within the British Empire, laying the foundation of the modern Canadian state.

events.title: The ZIP code is introduced in the United States
events.description: The United States Postal Service introduces the Zone Improvement Plan (ZIP) code system for mail delivery.
events.significance: The ZIP code system improved mail sorting and delivery efficiency, becoming a crucial part of US postal services.

events.title: Hong Kong Handover
events.description: Hong Kong is handed over from the United Kingdom to the People's Republic of China after 156 years of British colonial rule.
events.significance: The handover marked the end of British colonialism in Hong Kong, starting a 'one country, two systems' governance arrangement.
